name: Lisbon Tram
description:
The trams climb up and slip down the steep cobbled streets of Lisbon. Already steeped in culture and history, the smatterings of graffiti only add to the charm of this vintage classic and the appeal of such a special city. 

Prints available alone, or framed in our handmade frames made from reclaimed wood.

name: Wood E T2
description:
Inspired by the classic anglepoise design, this unique piece has been lovingly made from reclaimed hardwood window and door frames. Finished with contrasting orange braided wire for that vintage feel. Fully adjustable head and neck; simply twist the wing nuts to move the light into position. Designed as a desk or reading light, Wood E comes with a Bayonet fitting and is supplied with a high wattage, low energy, warm white bulb.

We are always happy to work with clients to adapt or work on bespoke designs, please contact us for more information.

name: Almost There
description:
The show-stopper. 
This statement piece is a sculptural suspension of hundreds of glasses lenses, hand cut, finished and joined together to create. This piece is made to order, but is worth the wait. 
Each one is completely unique, dimensions and lighting can be made specific to your space. We have installed versions of this piece creeping amongst the beams of barn conversions, suspended from the girders of loft apartments and hanging as chandeliers in stairwells.
Please contact us directly for further details, we would love to discuss potential ideas.

name: Dinky Drawers
description:
We have lovingly revived this cute little chest of drawers, which are absolutely perfect (we think) for a nursery, bedroom or bathroom. The main body has been painted in Paris Grey and the drawers in a contrasting Old Cream. The stunning top has been sanded back and waxed to show off its true beauty. The paint finish is silky, waterproof and wipe-proof, so should take some using.

We have added some gorgeous bun feet and matching handles and left them simply waxed, to match the top.

The main body of the drawers measure (cm): 71.5 (H) x 72 (W) x 40.5 (D)
The top panel has a slight overhang which is approx +3cm either side.

name: Pocket Atlas Drawers
description:
After the first set of Atlas Drawers went to their new home, a new client approached us requesting a bespoke set. 
We sourced this 60s utility style chest of drawers and set about stripping the thick varnish to reveal the stunning dark wood grain underneath. Painting the body again in Old Cream and this time using a 1930s Pocket Atlas, the client chose locations and regions which she held dear. 
Finished with some vintage utility cup handles, this piece came together and we shipped it off, wishing we could keep it! 

Bespoke requests are very much welcome! Drop us a note and we can discuss.

name: Atlas Treasure Chest
description:
A partner to the Atlas Drawers, this gorgeous old workmans box has been restored and painted with 'Old Cream' Eggshell paint and waxed for a durable finish. The lid has been transformed with pages from an old school Atlas (circa 1930). Complete with scribbles and notes in places, and locations stretching the empire it really is a unique piece.

We have added a rustic arrowhead hasp for you to put on your own padlock to keep your treasures safe and some reclaimed handles for quick moves and getaways.

name: Atlas Drawers
description:
These gorgeous little wooden Chest of Drawers, have been lovingly rescued and revived. Painted in 'Old Cream' Eggshell paint, the drawers finished in original Vintage Maps (circa 1930).

The top has been restored and replaced with reclaimed solid beech. Left unpainted, it has been finished with danish oil and a little beeswax for protection. 

The detail on the maps is beautiful, and locations range from the Amazon and Australia to Russia and Scotland. The pastel colours are stunning and lend themselves to a range of interior styles.

The original naturally tarnished brass drawer handles have been retained.

The runners have been waxed for smooth opening/closing.

They are small set, but with spacious drawers, which would look great anywhere! Initial thoughts were in a stylish children's bedroom, hallway or bathroom, but the choice is yours!


Overall Dimensions are (mm):
621 wide
730 tall
400 deep

Drawer dimensions (mm):
520 wide x 320 deep
Top:80 high
Middle: 135 high
Bottom: 180 high

name: Signaller's Spot
description: A completely unique composition. This vintage surveyors tripod has been fully restored and combined with a beautiful ships signalling light. Finished with braided wire and a medium wattage bulb, this statement piece will add atmospheric warmth to a cold corner of any room.

name: G-Plan Highboard
description:
Handpicked by us: Stylish Retro Storage for the Modern home!

Your chance to buy this beautiful, solid teak, danish inspired, highboard made by G-Plan. 

This is in fantastic condition, is really well crafted and is a design classic!

The drinks cabinet folds out, imagine mixing your cocktails from it!
The top cupboards have a nice removable shelf, the doors and hinges all feel like new. 
The top draw has cutlery dividers which can be removed really simply if required. Drawers have been waxed and slide in/out very smoothly.
Has original Gold Stamps in both drawers.
Leg base is removable for transport.

The quality of the craftsmanship really is outstanding for a 'mass produced' item, and will go on forever if looked after.

There are a few minor signs of wear and tear given its age, but are negligible and do not effect the look or style of this piece. Contact us for more detailed images.
